t: Jeremiah 5
The Depravity of Jerusalem
Roam*pn through the streets of Jerusalem. Investigate;*ln search*ln in her squares. If*ln you find one person, any*ln who acts justly, who*ln pursues faithfulness, then*ln I will forgive her.
When*ln they say, “As the Lord*s lives,” they*ln are swearing falsely.

Lord,*sln don’t your eyes look for faithfulness? You*ln have struck them, but they felt no pain. You*ln finished them off, but*ln they refused to accept discipline. They*ln made their faces harder than rock, and*ln they refused to return.
Then*p I thought: They*pn are just the poor; they*ln have been foolish. For*ln they don’t understand the way of the Lord,*s the*ln justice of their God.
I*ln will go to the powerful and*ln speak to them. Surely*ln they know the way of the Lord,*s the*ln justice of their God. However,*ln these also had broken the yoke and*ln torn off the chains.

Therefore,*ln a lion from the forest will strike them down. A*ln wolf from arid plains will ravage them. A*ln leopard stalks their cities. Anyone*ln who leaves them will be torn to pieces because*ln their rebellious acts are many, their*ln unfaithful deeds numerous.

Why*pn should I forgive you? Your*ln children have abandoned me and*ln sworn by those who are not gods. I*ln satisfied their needs, yet they committed adultery; they*ln gashed themselves at the prostitute’s house.
They*ln are well-fed, eager stallions, each*ln neighing after someone else’s wife.
Should*ln I not punish them for these things? This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. Should*pn I not avenge myself on*ln such a nation as this?
Go*pn up among her vineyard terraces and destroy them, but*ln do not finish them off. Prune*ln away her shoots, for*ln they do not belong to the Lord.*s
They,*ln the house of Israel and the house of Judah, have*ln dealt very treacherously with me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
They*pn have contradicted the Lord*s and*ln insisted, “It won’t happen. Harm*ln won’t come to us; we*ln won’t see sword or famine.”
The*ln prophets become only wind, for*ln the Lord’s*s word is not in them. This*ln will in fact happen to them.
Coming Judgment

Therefore,*p this is what the Lord God*s of Armies says: Because*pn you have spoken this word, I*ln am going to make my words become*ln fire in your mouth. These*ln people are the wood, and*ln the fire will consume them.

I*ln am about to bring a nation from*ln far away against you, house*ln of Israel. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. It*pn is an established nation, an*ln ancient nation, a*ln nation whose language you do not know and*ln whose speech you do not understand.
Their*ln quiver is like an open grave; they*ln are all warriors.

They*ln will consume your harvest and your food. They*ln will consume your sons and your daughters. They*ln will consume your flocks and your herds. They*ln will consume your vines and your fig trees. With*ln the sword they will destroy your*ln fortified cities in which you trust.
“But*p even in those days” - this is the Lord’s*s declaration - “I will not finish you off.

When people ask, ‘For what offense has the Lord*s our God done all these things to us? ’ You will respond to them, ‘Just as you abandoned me and served foreign gods in your land, so will you serve strangers in a land that is not yours.’
“Declare*p this in the house of Jacob; proclaim it in Judah, saying:
Hear*pn this, you*ln foolish and senseless people. They*ln have eyes, but they don’t see. They*ln have ears, but they don’t hear.

Do*ln you not fear me? This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. Do*pn you not tremble before me, the*ln one who set the sand as the boundary of the sea, an*ln enduring barrier that it cannot cross? The*ln waves surge, but they cannot prevail. They*ln roar but cannot pass over it.
But*ln these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts. They*ln have turned aside and have gone away.
They*ln have not said to themselves, ‘Let’s*ln fear the Lord*s our God, who*ln gives the seasonal rains, both autumn and spring, who*ln guarantees to us the fixed weeks of the harvest.’
Your*ln guilty acts have diverted these things from you. Your*ln sins have withheld my bounty from you,
for*ln wicked men live among my people. They*ln watch like hunters lying in wait. They*ln set a trap; they*ln catch men.
Like*ln a cage full of birds, so*ln their houses are full of deceit. Therefore*ln they have grown powerful and rich.

They*ln have become fat and sleek. They*ln have also excelled in evil matters. They*ln have not taken up cases, such*ln as the case of the fatherless, so they might prosper, and*ln they have not defended the rights of the needy.
Should*ln I not punish them for these things? This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. Should*pn I not avenge myself on*ln such a nation as this?
“An*pn appalling, horrible thing has*ln taken place in the land.
The*ln prophets prophesy falsely, and*ln the priests rule by their own authority. My*ln people love it like this. But*ln what will you do at the end of it?
